Pre-Game Insights: Christopher Morel, coming off a one-hit performance in his last game (1-for-2), will take the field for the Tampa Bay Rays versus Ben Lively and the Cleveland Guardians on Sunday. First pitch is at 1:40 PM ET on BSSUN.
Morel has recorded a hit 80 times this season in 140 games played (57.1%), including 19 multi-hit games (13.6%).
He has homered in 14.3% of his games this season (140 contests), leaving the ballpark in 3.7% of his plate appearances.
In 33.6% of his games this year (47 of 140), Morel has scored at least one run, and in eight of those games (5.7%) he recorded more than one run scored.

In 27.1% of his games this year (38 of 140), he has driven in at least one run. In 14 of those games (10.0%) he recorded more than one RBI, while accounting for three or more of his team’s runs in four contests.
Morel has gone down on strikes at least once 97 times this season in 140 games played (69.3%), including 46 times striking out multiple times (32.9%).
Miscellaneous Highlights: Christopher Morel vs. Ben Lively: Over his career versus Ben Lively, Morel is 0-for-3. Against Ben Lively last season, Morel was 0-for-3.
The Guardians will call on Lively (11-9) to make his 27th start of the season. He is 11-9 with a 4.01 ERA and 110 Ks through 137 2/3 innings pitched.
The right-hander’s last time out came on Tuesday versus the Chicago White Sox, as he tossed two scoreless innings while allowing just one hit.
The 32-year-old has posted a 4.01 ERA and 7.2 Ks per nine innings across 26 games this season, while allowing a batting average of.243 to opposing batters.
Lively is trying to register his 10th quality start in this matchup.
